title: Bug 5473 - ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces
description: Bug 5473ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces Build 200110251.
OB: When executing ShiftLeft on two lines of text that contain intermixed tabs and spaces, nothing happens and the text remains unchanged.
EB: After executing ShiftLeft on two lines of text that contain intermixed tabs and spaces, the text should be indented consistently. The second line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted left at least to the space character (i.e., remove the tab). It is also confusing when there is a stray space, as it prevents the text from shifting.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open a default text editor.
2. Type the following lines:
   <space>
   <tab>some text
   <tab>some text2
3. Highlight the two lines.
4. Execute the ShiftLeft command.

Expected result: The text should be indented consistently.
Actual result: Nothing happens and the text remains unchanged.
